intro: Tetraneuris trinervata, commonly known as the three-veined tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blooms. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Tetraneuris trinervata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
